title: Rust: Add `verify_with_jwks`
body:
Add method to verify using JWKs JSON response data. For details see #23 

Also moved shared test resources to `./test-resources/`, see included README. This will be used to share common test resources across all langs.

## Example
```rust
// jwks json of form: {"keys":[...]}
truelayer_signing::verify_with_jwks(jwks)
    .method("POST")
    .path("/webhook")
    .headers(headers)
    .body(body)
    .verify(tl_signature)?;
```

title: Php signing
body: This fixes a signing issue due to changing the header key casing, adds a code style fixer and a convenience method for easily signing PSR requests.

title: rust: support `jku` jws header
body:
When signing webhooks we want to also include a `jku` JSON Web Key URL which will be used to lookup the jwk public key to verify webhooks.

This PR supports adding a `jku` when signing & extracting it out of a signature using the rust lib. The former does not need wide support as clients will not need to set `jku` for regular requests. We should probably add extracting the jku to all langs though.

This is a non-breaking change.

title: Removed verifier's method default value and wrote a test for it.
body: As title says, removed verifier's method default value to conform to other implementations.

title: Java implementation
body:
Java implementation to produce & verify TrueLayer API requests signatures.

Java usage:
```java
// `Tl-Signature` value to send with the request.
Signer.from(kid, privateKey)
        .header("Idempotency-Key", idempotencyKey)
        .method("post")
        .path(path)
        .body(body)
        .sign();
```

title: C# throw SignatureException for missing jws headers
body: C# verify currently throws `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException` if required jws header fields are missing, such as `tl_version` or `alg`. This pr instead throws `SignatureException` to handle these simply as invalid signatures.

title: Fix C# allowing signatures with attached bodies + support C# & nodejs no-header usage
body:
Signatures are supposed to have detached bodies. We then populate the body during verification. However, if you send jws with an attached valid body, that otherwise would have failed validation the C# verify logic allowed it, as `.Replace("..", ...)` silently did nothing.

This pr fixes that, the C# lib requires detached jws signatures or throws a `SignatureException`.

Nodejs & rust were not vulnerable to this, but now have similar scenario tests to cover this.

### Support for signatures without any headers
I also found the nodejs & C# verifiers were requiring at least some headers. Otherwise they would fail requiring the empty string `""` header. All 3 langs now have scenarios ensuring that no-header usage is allowed.

title: [WIP] Move JS library to TS
body:
This PR migrates the javascript library from JS to TS.

The idea here is that we can emit the JS lib with TS types built in, so that JS consumers are unchanged, but TS consumers don't need a separate types declaration.

We're trying to do this with no breaking changes, and still including the original JSDoc typings.

title: Add go package
body:
# truelayer-signing
Go package to produce & verify TrueLayer API requests signatures.

```go
// `Tl-Signature` value to send with the request.
signature, err := tlsigning.SignWithPem(Kid, privateKeyBytes).
    Method("POST").
    Path("/payouts").
    Header("Idempotency-Key", idempotencyKey).
    Body(body).
    Sign()
```

title: Add javascript library
[PAYG-38] Add csharp TrueLayer.Signing lib
body:
# TrueLayer.Signing
C# library to produce & verify TrueLayer API requests signatures.

```xml
<PackageReference Include="TrueLayer.Signing" Version="_" />
```

```csharp
using TrueLayer.Signing;

// `Tl-Signature` value to send with the request.
var tlSignature = Signer.SignWithPem(kid, privateKey)
    .Method("POST")
    .Path(path)
    .Header("Idempotency-Key", idempotency_key)
    .Body(body)
    .Sign();
```

## Implementation notes
* ~I used `net5.0` runtime instead of LTS 3.1 because of the [`ImportFromPem` support](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.security.cryptography.rsa.importfrompem?view=net-5.0).~ Supports `netstandard2.1` & `net5.0`.
* Signing/verifying v1 body-only signatures is not supported. We could add this, similar to the rust lib, if desired. However, this shouldn't be necessary (from a signer pov) with paydirect-api v1 forwards supporting full request signatures.

title: Add `Signer::headers` & `Verifier::headers`
body: Allows adding multiple headers at once fluently, equivalent to `.extend(..)`.

title: Verifier: Make v1 body-only support opt-in
body: Make verifier backward compatibility support for v1 body-only signatures opt-in. This prevents new resources from accidentally also supporting the less secure v1 signatures.

title: Use key pem `&[u8]` instead of `&str`
body: For users its easier to go from `&str` -> `&[u8]` than vice-versa and we actually just need `&[u8]`.

title: Allow non-utf8 header values
body: We don't need to require `&str` utf-8 header values, we can use `&[u8]` instead to be more flexible.

title: Rename to truelayer-signing
body:
Rename to `truelayer-signing` (I'll rename the repo too after merging).

Any other name ideas?
